Package org.frc5010.common.config.json

Class CameraConfigurationJson

java.lang.Object
org.frc5010.common.config.json.CameraConfigurationJson
public class CameraConfigurationJson extends Object
Configuration data class for camera systems in an FRC robot.

This class represents the JSON configuration for a single camera, including its type (Limelight, PhotonVision, AprilTag), physical pose relative to the robot center, and calibration parameters. The configuration supports both real hardware and simulation modes.

Configuration is typically loaded from JSON files and used to instantiate the appropriate camera implementation (LimeLightCamera, PhotonVisionCamera, etc.) via the configureCamera(GenericRobot) method.

    • name

      public String name
      Unique name of the camera used as a subsystem identifier

    • use

      public String use
      The use case for this camera. Valid values include:
      • "target" - for target tracking systems
      • "apriltag" - for AprilTag-based pose estimation
      • "quest" - for QuestNav visual odometry

    • type

      public String type
      The camera vendor/type. Valid values include:
      • "limelight" - Limelight camera
      • "photonvision" - PhotonVision camera
      Defaults to "none" if not specified.

    • strategy

      public String strategy
      The pose estimation strategy for PhotonVision cameras (e.g., "AVERAGE_BEST_TARGETS", "LOWEST_AMBIGUITY"). Defaults to "none" if not using multi-target pose estimation.

    • column

      public int column
      The SmartDashboard column index for this camera's telemetry display

      Camera Y position offset from robot center in meters (left/right in robot frame)

    • targetFiducialIds

      public int[] targetFiducialIds
      Optional array of AprilTag fiducial IDs to track. If empty, all AprilTags may be detected depending on the configuration strategy.

  • Method Details

    • configureCamera

      public void configureCamera(GenericRobot robot)
      Configures the camera system based on the provided robot and current configuration.

      This method performs the following operations:

      1. Creates the appropriate camera instance based on the type field (real hardware or simulation)
      2. Initializes camera parameters (resolution, FOV, pose relative to robot)
      3. Sets up the camera according to its configured use case:
        • "target" - Creates a target tracking system
        • "apriltag" - Registers camera with pose estimator for localization
        • "quest" - Initializes QuestNav visual odometry system
      4. Registers the camera/vision system with the robot

      The method handles both real and simulated robot modes (RobotBase.isReal()). In simulation, cameras are created with physics-based simulation capabilities.

      Parameters:
      robot - the GenericRobot instance to configure the camera for. The robot must have a drivetrain subsystem with a pose estimator if using pose-based vision modes
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the camera type or use case is not recognized
      NullPointerException - if required subsystems (e.g., drivetrain) are not available for the specified use case
